tasks.title: Configure Supabase Backend
tasks.description: Set up Supabase project and configure the `meetings` table with required columns.
tasks.details:
Create a new Supabase project. Define the `meetings` table with columns: id (UUID), title (text), time (timestamp), content (text), created_at (timestamp), updated_at (timestamp). Enable row-level security if required. Install Supabase JS SDK v2.39.0+.

subtasks.title: Implement responsive design for the table

For mobile views, consider a card-like layout instead of traditional table rows. Implement appropriate text sizing and padding adjustments for different viewports. Test overflow handling for long content in table cells.

subtasks.title: Add clickable row functionality

Include visual feedback on hover using Tailwind's hover: classes (e.g., hover:bg-gray-100). Consider adding a subtle transition effect for better UX. Ensure the entire row is clickable, not just specific cells.

subtasks.title: Ensure Accessibility and Focus Management
subtasks.description: Implement accessibility features such as focus trapping, keyboard navigation, and hiding background content from assistive technologies.
subtasks.details:
Leverage Hero UI's built-in accessibility or add ARIA attributes and focus management manually. Ensure Esc key closes the drawer and tabbing is contained within the drawer.
<info added on 2025-07-07T18:57:31.850Z>
## Accessibility Features Implemented:
**ARIA Attributes & Roles**:
- `role="dialog"` on drawer container
- `aria-modal="true"` to indicate modal behavior
- `aria-label` or title-based labeling for screen readers
- `aria-hidden="true"` on overlay to hide from assistive tech
- `role="document"` on drawer panel for content identification

**Focus Management**:
- Focus trapping within drawer when open
- Initial focus set to drawer panel on open
- Focus restoration to trigger element on close
- Last active element stored and restored properly

**Keyboard Navigation**:
- ESC key closes drawer (handled via useCallback)
- Tab/Shift+Tab cycling contained within drawer
- All interactive elements accessible via keyboard
- Focus indicators visible for keyboard users

**Form Accessibility**:
- Proper label associations (`htmlFor` attributes)
- Input fields have descriptive labels
- Focus states on form inputs (ring-2 ring-blue-500)
- Semantic HTML structure maintained

**Button Accessibility**:
- Close button has `aria-label="Close drawer"`
- All buttons have proper focus states and hover indicators
- Disabled states handled appropriately
- Button text descriptive ("Cancel", "Save", "Edit")

**Screen Reader Support**:
- Semantic HTML5 elements used throughout
- Proper heading hierarchy (h2, h3, h4)
- Content structure logical and accessible
- Status announcements for state changes

**Color & Contrast**:
- Tailwind color utilities ensure sufficient contrast
- Focus rings provide clear visual indication
- Error states use appropriate red color contrast
- Text colors meet WCAG guidelines

**Body Scroll Management**:
- Background content not scrollable when drawer open
- Prevents focus from escaping to background content
- Scroll position restored on drawer close

## Technical Implementation Details:
- **useEffect** for focus management lifecycle
- **useCallback** for optimized event handlers
- **Portal rendering** for proper DOM structure
- **Ref management** for focus restoration
- **Event delegation** for keyboard handling

All accessibility requirements fully satisfied for WCAG 2.1 compliance.
</info added on 2025-07-07T18:57:31.850Z>
subtasks.testStrategy: Test with keyboard and screen reader to confirm focus is trapped, Esc key works, and background content is inaccessible while the drawer is open.

subtasks.title: Integrate Drawer with Meeting Minutes Data
subtasks.description: Connect the drawer component to the meeting minutes data source, enabling view and edit functionality within the drawer.
subtasks.details:
Pass meeting minutes data as props or via context. Implement form fields for editing and display components for viewing. Ensure changes are saved or discarded appropriately.
<info added on 2025-07-07T18:58:02.864Z>
The drawer component has been successfully integrated with meeting minutes data and supports all three operational modes (view, edit, create). 

Data integration is complete with view mode displaying meeting data passed as props via selectedMeeting state, showing dynamic titles, formatted time, last updated information, and properly formatted content with empty state handling. Edit mode pre-populates form fields with existing meeting data using defaultValue from selectedMeeting, with appropriate input types and smooth state transitions. Create mode provides clean forms with empty fields and helpful placeholders.

The data flow implementation uses state management through selectedMeeting, drawerMode, and isDrawerOpen variables. Meeting data flows from table clicks to state to drawer components using props-based passing for reactivity. Mode transitions work correctly between view, edit and create modes.

Form fields are properly mapped to meeting data properties (title, time, content, updated_at), with appropriate display features including date formatting, whitespace preservation, fallback text for empty fields, and consistent styling across modes.

The implementation is ready for future tasks with save functionality placeholders, form validation structure, data persistence hooks, and error handling structure in place.
</info added on 2025-07-07T18:58:02.864Z>
